So far I have tried a few of their beers and have liked each one. I also have had their pizza special which is delicious and decently priced. I recommend coming here to give it a try.   If you're into sports the location has TVs all around the the establishment showing a wide variety of sports.   Of all the times I have been here the service has been excellent as well.

We've been to Oggi's so many times but after a night like tonight we may question that decision to go back! We had to get our own water refills, ask for our own plates, got served our pizzas as two different times -seriously waited 10 minutes before they brought out the other pizza, and waited at least 15 minutes just to get a beer from the bar! Terrible service

This place is terrible. Beer is warm, the traditional calzone was disgusting, popcorn chicken for kids is spicy with pepper, tomatoes on salad were left with the core on. Just laziness and lack of caring. This could be a great neighborhood spot. It's more like people come here by default since there is nothing but crappy chain restaurants saturating Arrowhead.  Seriously, save your money.

I'm not sure why this place has bad reviews. My buddy insisted it was good even though I didn't want to go based on the reviews. He talked us into going tonight, Friday. I have zero complaints! Our pizza was great, beers were above average, and service was definitely above par. We will be back!
A great place to have a drink and just hang out. The pizza is not all that, flat out its bad. I may try something else if I go back. Tip to the ownership...do better on the food.

Family came ordered the regular thing We also ordered a pizza for the first time.  We did not like the way it tasted! The waitress went above and beyond to remove it from Bill showing us just tell customer service should be done! Not only do they have great service that is exceptional would recommend them to everyone!
Decent food. Nothing to write home about. Service was ok. I might go back, but not something Ill develop a crave for.

Food was too greasy, lacked taste and flavor quality, service was great!  Patti melt was over cooked.  Loaded fries were a gross second to Chillis loaded Texas fries.  Cheesy bread and dips were good.   The old fashioned sundae was great!

This maybe a little biased as I work here, but as a food aspect the food is great and love coming in with my family. As a work aspect, the people that I work with are great and it's truly like working with family.
Found them by Happen chance.  One of the most flavorful Pizzas Ive had. Will definitely return to explore more of the Menu.

Probably the worst bar food experience I've had in a long time. Service was horrible and the food was worse. Thanks for the 7 extra small boneless wings for $10 and thanks for the horrible recommendation on the Philly.   Never again. BTW, it was only 2 pm and the place was empty but I guess my money isn't as green as the guys at the bar drinking their life away.   You suck oggi's

Oggi's on a Monday was a good choice because it wasn't too packed. Although basketball and football was on. The waitress was friendly. I wanted a burger and ordered the guacamole burger with sweet potato fries and I was disappointed, the food was flavorless. I heard they're known for their pizza, maybe I should have gotten that instead.

I love this place! They have awesome and delicious pizza, appetizers and drinks. Looking at it from the outside, I'd expected to large pizza restaurant, something that would a little crazy but it was the complete opposite. It was a nice size place and loved the vibe of it. You can relax, not have to deal with a big or loud crowd. The drinks are very tasty and I really like how they recommend which beer goes perfectly with which pizza. It makes it easier to order

Unfortunately, we had a very frustrating experience at this place. We had two hours for dinner anticipating spending an hour on dinner, but the service was so slow that our entire two hours were spent here. First of all, there was a sign on the door advertising help needed for cooks and servers; that should have been the first clue that service would be slow.  After waiting for 15 minutes, I went to the front of the restaurant to ask for drinks and menus. The lady was apologetic and told me someone would be by soon. Another five minutes later and a guy was by to take our order for drinks, which we received after ten minutes. Once we received our food, I was completely underwhelmed with the taste of my food, as was my husband. I felt like I was eating food I could cook with my very minimal cooking skills. My husband had to ask three times for a glass of water, which he got minutes before leaving.  Positives-the beer was tasty and the staff was friendly.  We will not be returning for a repeat performance. Ever.
We ordered chicken sandwiches , the jalapeño one and the club and they were both pretty good. I was not a fan of the fries. They were too crispy and had a bit too much seasoning on it.

Wow people you should really check the address and review the correct Oggi's. This place is worth coming to Friday and Saturdays tend to be a little busy especially in the bar. Appetizers are good they could have a little better selection but its a pizza/sports bar kinda place, the pizza is yummy especially the Boce' Ball its other worldly.  Happy hour is awesome 2 for 1 drafts with purchase of food and after 6pm then its dollar pints for some decent beer trust me I know beer. Total Wine...tried all the beer there.  Best beer there in my opinion is the Scottish Ale but thats only my opinion.

Everything I expected and more . Great menu and the dry rub wings are not on the menu but if you ask it's super delicious . The matador burger was super super yummy and spicy too . The hopily ever after is super ever after :). Fun place excellent service too :) atmosphere super casual and yet clean too gray plus

Arrived to sit down with a good crowd & ambiance. Soon a stinky bar tender assisted with our order. His body oder was so offensive that it made me gag... We didn't want him to come near us. Couldn't even enjoy our meal. Came here on a Monday evening to watch a football game.

This place has gone really down hill :(  I was in last weekend after a hockey on a saturday at 9pm.  The ladies bathroom was gross.  The service was lacking in friendliness and timeliness-and all we had was beer and appetizers!  We used to love coming here, but will definitely think twice.
I'm from WI and found my new fav micro-brew spot! Beers are wonderful and prices are cheap. Try the Won Ton Nachos!!!

For the price, the beers can't be beat. However, if you're hoping to watch a game be aware that good seating is limited. The TVs are dated and mounted in such a way that if you're sitting in a booth along the outer wall, you'll more than likely have to crane your neck to see. But I digress, still worth it for the low cost drink  factor!

Ordered 2 custom burgers from them (Angus with swiss, mushroom, and sauteed onions) and seasoned fries. The food took an hour and a half to get here the first time because of traffic, and was cold.   Why did I give it 5 stars? Because when I called to complain the general manager, Shane, remade the order himself and brought it back out in less than 30 minutes.  The food was amazing, but the fact that the manager specifically went out of his way to make sure we were satisfied really put this place over the top for me.

This used to be one of my favorite nearby restaurants, but the front staff seems to have changed, and I guess the cooks have changed, too.  My wife's chicken was almost completely raw, and about 1/3 of my tilapia was uncooked.  We won't take a chance on anything but beer and pizza in the future.  Cooks really shouldn't be learning on the job.
Great food!  Did delivery on a Friday night, so took a little over the 60 minutes. Worth the wait!  Only snag, they forgot the lettuce wraps, found out after they closed.

Wow how wrong could a reccomendation have been to try this place.  I heard about good pizza and good wings so I decided to check it out.  I ordered the New Yorker pizza and the "killer" boneless wings.  First of all the total for that and soda was over $30 which is rediculous but if it was amazing ok fine I'll deal.  Well the pizza was very underwhelming and the toppings were just laid on not even cooked into the pizza.  The wings were far from killer hot barely even on the mild scale.  There was a huge lack of sauce.  Just overall I was not impressed and for sure will take my pizza and wing business elsewhere.

Dissappointed. i've necer had chicken cooked as hard as my pollo pizziola was today. it tasted pretty good but was very tough! others in our party were unhappy with the wings - too few per order, hot wasnt hot - calamari was not good. the only thing anyone was happy with was the burgers.

Went again last night and the service was even better then before. I'm not sure why I gave them only 3 stars last time. Oh wait, now I remember. It was mostly because of the small app portions. Well, we stayed away from the tiny apps this time, and now the place and the setup is starting to grow on me.  Happy hour food specials are there but limited and still not a GREAT bargain. Happy hour drinks are a much better deal. If you go, try the 8 beer sampler (see pic). It was lots of fun for $9 and the calzone was just enough to soak up all the alcohol. Double YUM! Wife had the boneless wings (buffalo sauce) and the loaded fries (covered in cheese, bacon bits and chives). Both were good but the fries were especially addicting. If you don't pay any attention to all the mismatched paint touch-up spots and dings in the walls, the place even starts to look a little upscale, or maybe the beer goggles were just a little foggy last night. You be the judge.

I enjoyed this place.  I've never been to any of the other locations.  The pizza was decent, very cheesy and a soft, thicker crust.  The best part was the beer sampler.  I can't remember all the different kinds they had, but it was a good way to try them all.  The service was good too.  The building is a little bit too open for  brewery in my opinion.  It's like a Denny's.  The bar here is nothing special either.  It looks like they close around 9 or 10 at night so those coming here hoping for nightlift will be disappointed.  But if you want dinner and a beer or two, give it a shot.
Had the Wimbledon it was crispy and delicious will come back again and try the beer

I have seen several good reviews so my wife and I decided to give Oggi's a try. Since pizza and Italian style food appeared to be their specialty, I ordered pizza. As I stated in my tip, the crust was hard and crunchy. My wife usually orders a salad and then eats the outer crust of my pizza. We've been married 20+ years and this is literally the first time she rejected my leftover crust because it was too hard and dry to eat. Their Scottish ale was very good and the insides of the pizza were decent as well although the heat that hardened the crust also desiccated some of the topmost ingredients. In all, we found it to be average, as sports bars go with below average food and above average beer. There are lots of sports bars around and more and more artisan breweries and brewpubs all the time. A sports bar/brewpub needs something to make it stand out and invite me back. Unfortunately, this place does not have that.
Good food, good beer, kiddo friendly and had good service :)  Was easy and good for happy hour
We sat outside with our two dogs on the dog-friendly patio. The server brought water for everyone right away, including the dogs. Happy hour food was generous and we saw a great sunset.

Beers are mediocre here.  They got rid of their best beer last year, the Bavarian style Hefe-Weizen and replaced it with a watered down American wheat.  Appetizers are above average and an exceptional value during happy hour.  Pizza is very average.  If you're a beer enthusiast then don't bother, but if you like fried appetizers, cheesy breadsticks (Oggi stix), then this place will work for you.

Not bad, not great. Very open concept seating, meaning wherever you're sitting, you have a full view of everything. Think of their dining area as a huge great room. Bar included, although sectioned off by some booths. Saturday night, very busy, long wait. I think it's because there just isn't much in that area unless you want to head south a couple blocks to the Arrowhead area. Just another average bar and grill.

Great neighborhood place to get great pizza, beer, and watch a game!  We stop by about once per week, and have always had great food and service! We've ordered the "Heavyweight" Pizza each time, and it's been great!  Loaded with meat, and cooked to perfection!  We will definately keep coming back!

the food is great here they offer you 10$ off a pizza when you check in on yelp. the place was busy it was happy hour and the server was slow but we order a good portion of our food right away when he ask us what we wanted to drink the beer was not that great i order a hefenwezin their where no carbonation but the server did switch my beer  to a better one  then when i order again they brought me the same beer that had no carbonation. they server was asking if we need anything more to eat or drink as you could tell he wanted to clear the table but we just wanted to drink and stay a little longer .  for a Friday night it was busy but the food was good  the beer not so much   if you go during happy hour  on a Friday night  don't aspect fast serves
Love this place. Our waitress was amazing with our large party. Their BBQ pizza is wonderful and their microbrews are great. Definitely recommend this place

Busy restaurant.  I went on a Saturday night.  But not too busy that I had to wait for seating.  I like the booth seating.  Staff was cheery and came to our table often.  We ordered the Hawaiian and boneless wings.  Both were nothing to write home about.  The crust on the pizza was quite bland.  The wing sauce was good but not superior.  I ordered the Golden Blond beer.  Pretty tasty! I would definitely come back for the beer but the food was mediocre.

I never have high expectations for sports bars, there isn't any reason to.  Walking in to Oggi's, I felt no different than I do walking in to any other similar establishment.  We came in and were seated in a half full restaurant.  The bar area was fairly busy as there was a game going on.  The food is really not good.  Everything is quite greasy, and not in a good way.  Trust me, I like greasy.  They were also out of multiple menu items and a couple beers.  Of course, they didn't inform us of that beforehand, so  when I ordered the dish I wanted, I was told no, then my husband ordered what he wanted and told no again!  JEEZ!  I guess they have never heard of prepping.  I finally settled on the fettucini alfredo, as it's a simple dish and hard to screw up.  Well, they did.  It's all very generic, and the pasta was overcooked and mushy.  Ugh.  Service was so-so.  I will not be back, simple as that.  I don't recommend this place to anyone.
